title: [backlog/low] Improve validation of instance bounds (max bound, and adding to frontend)
body:
### Propose we validate max bounds too

We have some function for validation that the box is within the bounds of the image, for example
eg like https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/blob/2844903e17f6b4758c2a339e46222e32eb706e3a/shared/annotation.py#L1364

It doesn't yet cover savings values that exceed the canvas area. Like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18080164/129294199-6018c753-7cbc-4734-af64-6b00d4ee0655.png)

Near that code, there's some old comment , I think I wrote, on there about load time of image (similar for frame) - but that doesn't make sense since we would clearly already have that data from loading the file - so that comment can be deleted.

### Propose front end catch validate bounds too so that's better aligned.

Not sure if there's much point having out of bounds - eg negative - values allowed on frontend, since the backend will force to bounds, eg similar 0 or max image size. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18080164/129294602-18f80fbe-55e1-487a-8024-4369f907bd46.png)


This was in the context of testing the duplicate hashing, and reflecting on alignment between backend validations and frontend validations
